result.execSummary:
The defendant Jay M Greene was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jay M Greene in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Jay M Greene in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:
John G.
AS TO COUNT 2:
  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 9 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence and concurrent to Count 3, with credit for 167 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and AODA treatment.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 8/14/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 8/14/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 9 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence and concurrent to Count 2, with credit for 167 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and AODA treatment.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 8/14/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 8/14/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Jay M Greene in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Jay M Greene in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
On State's motion, Court ordered COUNT 1 DISMISSED and read in.  As to COUNTS 2 and 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Parties advised that effective 8-3-14, case will be reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17, in room 313 of the safety building.    Request for substitution made by defense counsel.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Carolina Stark, Br. 17.  Defendant is advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case, pursuant to current court rules, to Judge Siefert, Br. 47.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anne A Devitt in court, defendant Jay M Greene not in court, in custody.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp   Court in trial this date; case adjourned.  Defendant shall be present at next hearing for motion to consolidate.  Hearing scheduled for 07-23-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anne A Devitt in court, defendant Jay M Greene not in court, in custody.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was NOT PRODUCED.  Defendant has a pending case in Waukesha County and was transferred to that county prior to this one.  Case may be consolidated with Waukesha County case.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 26.  Status conference scheduled for 06-24-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jay M Greene not in court, in custody.  Attorney Anne A Devitt appeared for the defense.  Patricia Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-17-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jay M Greene in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Daugherty).  Court DENIED defense motion for modification of bail.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bail

Defendant Jay M Greene in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Jay M Greene in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. eam
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court entered a plea of not guilty.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed, and no alcohol. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jay M Greene in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Jay M Greene in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defense moves to dimiss COUNT 3 of the complaint. Arguments heard. State moves to amend page 3 of the complaint second full paragraph to Defendant Greene and case number 13CF1218 corrected to read Kenosha County. Court denies Defense Motion to Dismiss Ct. 3 and grants State's request to amend complaint. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
